title: Madurai
summary: Madurai (/ˈmædjʊraɪ/ MA-DHU-RYE,[4][5] also US: /ˌmɑːdəˈraɪ/ MAH-də-RYE[5][6][7]) is a major city in the Indian state of Tamil Nadu. It is the cultural capital of Tamil Nadu and the administrative headquarters of Madurai District. As of the 2011 census, it was the third largest Urban agglomeration in Tamil Nadu after Chennai and Coimbatore and the 44th most populated city in India.[8] Located on the banks of River Vaigai, Madurai has been a major settlement for two millennia. It is often referred to as "Thoonga Nagaram", meaning "the city which never sleeps".[9]
